title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ecclesiastes chapter 9 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ecclesiastes Chapter 9.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 9:1, whose works are in the hand of God?
questions.explanation: Verse 1 states that the righteous, the wise, and their works are in the hand of God.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 9:2 say comes alike to all people?
questions.explanation: Verse 2 explains that there is one event that comes to the righteous, the wicked, the good, and the sinner alike.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 9:4 states that a dead lion is better than a living dog.
questions.explanation: Verse 4 says that a living dog is better than a dead lion.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 9:5, what do the dead not know?
questions.explanation: Verse 5 states that the dead know nothing and have no more reward.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 9:7 encourage people to do with their bread and wine?
options: Eat with joy and drink with a merry heart
questions.correctAnswer: Eat with joy and drink with a merry heart
questions.explanation: Verse 7 instructs to eat bread with joy and drink wine with a merry heart because God accepts your works.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Let thy garments be always ______; and let thy head lack no ointment.'
questions.explanation: Verse 8 says to let thy garments be always white and thy head lack no ointment.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 9:9, with whom should you live joyfully?
questions.explanation: Verse 9 encourages living joyfully with the wife whom you love all your days.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 9:10 say you should do with whatever your hand finds to do?
questions.explanation: Verse 10 instructs to do with all your might whatever your hand finds to do.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 9:11 says the race is always to the swift.
questions.explanation: Verse 11 states that the race is not to the swift, nor the battle to the strong, indicating chance affects outcomes.

questions.question: What comparison is made in Ecclesiastes 9:12 about the sons of men?
options: Like fishes in a net and birds in a snare
questions.correctAnswer: Like fishes in a net and birds in a snare
questions.explanation: Verse 12 compares men to fishes taken in a net and birds caught in a snare, snared suddenly by evil time.

questions.question: Where did the great king come against according to Ecclesiastes 9:14?
options: A little city with few men
questions.correctAnswer: A little city with few men
questions.explanation: Verse 14 describes a great king coming against a little city with few men and besieging it.

questions.question: What did the poor wise man do in the city mentioned in Ecclesiastes 9:15?
options: Delivered the city by his wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: Delivered the city by his wisdom
questions.explanation: Verse 15 says the poor wise man delivered the city by his wisdom, though no one remembered him.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 9:17 says the words of wise men are heard more in quiet than the cry of rulers among fools.
questions.explanation: Verse 17 confirms that wise men's words are heard more in quiet than the loud cries of rulers among fools.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 9:18, what is wisdom better than?
questions.explanation: Verse 18 states that wisdom is better than weapons of war.

questions.question: What is described as an evil among all things done under the sun in Ecclesiastes 9:3?
questions.explanation: Verse 3 describes that it is an evil that there is one event unto all people under the sun.

medium.title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with uncertainty about the outcomes of their efforts. Based on Ecclesiastes 9, what biblical truth would you share about trusting God in their work?
options: Do your work with all your might because success depends on time and chance, which are beyond human control
Wait passively for God to act without putting in effort
Only work when you feel certain of success
Avoid hard work because the outcome is unpredictable
questions.correctAnswer: Do your work with all your might because success depends on time and chance, which are beyond human control
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:10 encourages doing whatever your hand finds to do with all your might, while Ecclesiastes 9:11 teaches that the race is not to the swift nor bread to the wise, but time and chance happen to all. This shows the importance of diligent work combined with trusting God for the outcome.

questions.question: How does Ecclesiastes 9 teach us about the value of wisdom in Christian living?
options: Wisdom is better than strength and weapons of war, but it can be despised or ignored
Strength is more important than wisdom
Wealth and riches are the ultimate proof of wisdom
Only the powerful can appreciate wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom is better than strength and weapons of war, but it can be despised or ignored
questions.explanation: Verses Ecclesiastes 9:16-18 show that wisdom surpasses strength and weapons, yet the poor man's wisdom is often despised and his words unheeded. This teaches humility and perseverance in sharing wisdom despite opposition.

questions.question: A believer is feeling discouraged because their good deeds seem unnoticed. What encouragement does Ecclesiastes 9 offer regarding the value of righteous works?
options: The righteous and their works are in the hand of God, who accepts them even if men do not remember
Good works are only valuable when publicly recognized
Only works done for fame are accepted by God
Righteous deeds have no lasting value
questions.correctAnswer: The righteous and their works are in the hand of God, who accepts them even if men do not remember
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:1 and 9:7 state that the righteous and their works are in God’s hand and that God accepts our works. Ecclesiastes 9:15 also illustrates that wise deeds may go unnoticed by men but still have value.

questions.question: What practical advice does Ecclesiastes 9 give about enjoying life and marriage?
options: Live joyfully with the wife you love all your days, as this is your portion in life
Marriage is a burden and should be endured with patience
Avoid joy and focus only on spiritual matters
Marriage should be postponed until after all work is done
questions.correctAnswer: Live joyfully with the wife you love all your days, as this is your portion in life
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:9 advises to live joyfully with the wife you love throughout your life, highlighting the blessing and portion of marriage in a God-given life under the sun.

questions.question: How does Ecclesiastes 9 describe the condition of both the righteous and the wicked in life?
options: All experience the same fate of death, regardless of their righteousness or wickedness
The wicked always prosper while the righteous suffer
Only the righteous live long lives
The wicked have no hope at all
questions.correctAnswer: All experience the same fate of death, regardless of their righteousness or wickedness
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:2 explains that the same event (death) comes to the righteous and wicked alike, showing the universality of death under the sun.

questions.question: Based on Ecclesiastes 9, what is the significance of living while you can, rather than focusing on the dead?
options: The living have hope and awareness, while the dead know nothing and have no reward
The dead can influence the living’s fortunes
The living and dead have equal influence on life
The dead are more powerful than the living
questions.correctAnswer: The living have hope and awareness, while the dead know nothing and have no reward
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:4-6 contrasts the living who have hope and knowledge with the dead who know nothing and have no further portion under the sun.

questions.question: How does Ecclesiastes 9 encourage a believer to face the unpredictability of life and death?
options: Recognize that no one knows their time, so live diligently and wisely
Ignore the future and live recklessly
Only focus on earthly riches to secure your future
Avoid all risks to prevent sudden trouble
questions.correctAnswer: Recognize that no one knows their time, so live diligently and wisely
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:11-12 teaches that time and chance happen to all and that man does not know his time, so the wise response is to live with diligence and wisdom.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 9 say about the heart of mankind and its condition during life?
options: The heart of the sons of men is full of evil and madness while they live
The heart is always pure and wise
All men are righteous in their hearts
questions.correctAnswer: The heart of the sons of men is full of evil and madness while they live
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:3 states that the heart of men is full of evil and madness during their lifetime, highlighting the fallen nature of humanity.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ecclesiastes 9, the memory of the dead and their emotions like love and hatred continue forever.
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:5-6 explains that the dead know nothing, and their love, hatred, and envy have perished; they have no portion forever in anything done under the sun.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 9 teaches that one sinner can destroy much good, emphasizing the need for vigilance in Christian living.
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:18 warns that while wisdom is better than weapons of war, one sinner can destroy much good, highlighting the power of sin and the importance of holiness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ecclesiastes 9:7 advises, 'Go thy way, eat thy _____ with joy, and drink thy wine with a merry heart; for God now accepteth thy works.'
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:7 teaches to enjoy bread and wine with joy because God accepts your works, emphasizing gratitude and contentment in daily life.

questions.question: How does Ecclesiastes 9 instruct believers regarding personal appearance and self-care?
options: Let your garments be always white and your head lack no ointment
Ignore personal appearance as it is unimportant
Only care for appearance when others are watching
Save all resources for spiritual activities
questions.correctAnswer: Let your garments be always white and your head lack no ointment
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:8 encourages maintaining personal cleanliness and joy, symbolized by white garments and ointment, as part of enjoying life and honoring God.

questions.question: A believer is feeling unnoticed despite their wise counsel. Based on Ecclesiastes 9, what biblical principle can encourage them?
options: The words of wise men are heard more in quiet than the cry of rulers among fools
Power is more important than wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: The words of wise men are heard more in quiet than the cry of rulers among fools
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:17 teaches that wise counsel is more effective in quiet and humility than loud authority among fools, encouraging perseverance in godly wisdom.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 9 say about the timing of events and human knowledge of them?
options: Man does not know his time; events come unexpectedly like fish caught in a net
Humans can predict all future events accurately
Events only happen when planned by people
questions.correctAnswer: Man does not know his time; events come unexpectedly like fish caught in a net
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:12 compares man’s ignorance of his time to fish caught suddenly in a net, emphasizing human limitations and the need for trust in God.

questions.question: How does Ecclesiastes 9 illustrate the power of wisdom over physical strength through a story?
options: A poor wise man delivered a city from a great king’s siege, but was forgotten
Strong armies always win over cities
questions.correctAnswer: A poor wise man delivered a city from a great king’s siege, but was forgotten
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:14-15 recounts how a poor wise man saved a city by his wisdom, illustrating wisdom’s superiority over strength, even if unrecognized.

hard.title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ecclesiastes Chapter 9.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 9:1, in whose hand are the righteous, the wise, and their works?
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:1 states that the righteous, the wise, and their works are in the hand of God, emphasizing divine sovereignty over human affairs.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 9:2 say about the fate of the righteous and the wicked?
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:2 explains that all things come alike to all people, whether righteous or wicked, highlighting the inevitability of death.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 9:3 states that the heart of the sons of men is full of what two things while they live?
questions.explanation: The verse describes that human hearts are full of evil and madness during life, reflecting a pessimistic view of human nature under the sun.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Ecclesiastes 9:4: 'For to him that is joined to all the living there is ____, for a living dog is better than a dead lion.'
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:4 emphasizes that there is hope for those alive, contrasting a living dog with a dead lion to illustrate the value of life.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 9:5 teaches that the dead know and have rewards after death.
questions.explanation: The verse clearly states the dead know nothing and have no more reward, emphasizing the finality of death under the sun.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 9:7 encourage people to do with their bread and wine?
options: Eat with joy and drink with a merry heart
questions.correctAnswer: Eat with joy and drink with a merry heart
questions.explanation: The verse encourages joyful enjoyment of life’s simple pleasures because God accepts one's works.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 9:8 advises to keep garments white and not to let the head lack what?
questions.explanation: The verse uses the imagery of white garments and ointment (likely oil for the head) to symbolize cleanliness and joy.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 9:9, what is considered 'thy portion in this life'?
options: Living joyfully with the wife thou lovest
questions.correctAnswer: Living joyfully with the wife thou lovest
questions.explanation: The verse highlights companionship and joy in marriage as one’s portion in the fleeting life under the sun.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 9:10 instructs to do whatever thy hand findeth to do with what attitude?
questions.explanation: The verse stresses wholehearted effort in all endeavors because the grave is a place without work or wisdom.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 9:11 illustrate about the outcome of races, battles, and wealth?
options: Time and chance happen to all
questions.correctAnswer: Time and chance happen to all
questions.explanation: This verse teaches that success is not guaranteed by strength, speed, or wisdom alone, but is subject to chance and timing.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 9:12 uses the analogy of fishes and birds caught in nets to describe what about man?
options: Man does not know his time
questions.correctAnswer: Man does not know his time
questions.explanation: The verse portrays humans as unaware of the time of their calamity, likening it to animals caught unexpectedly.

questions.question: In Ecclesiastes 9:15, what is the fate of the poor wise man who delivered the city?
questions.explanation: Despite his wisdom and heroic act, he was forgotten, illustrating the theme that wisdom is often undervalued.

questions.question: What comparison does Ecclesiastes 9:16 make between wisdom and strength?
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly states that wisdom surpasses strength, despite the poor man's wisdom being despised.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 9:18 states that one sinner can destroy much good despite the superiority of wisdom over weapons.
questions.explanation: The verse warns that even though wisdom is better than weapons, a single sinner can cause great harm.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 9:17 suggests that words of wise men are more heard in what kind of environment?
questions.explanation: The verse contrasts the calm reception of wise words in quiet with the loud cries of fools in authority.

theological.title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ecclesiastes Chapter 9 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 9:1, in whose hand are the righteous, the wise, and their works?
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:1 states that the righteous, the wise, and their works are in the hand of God, emphasizing divine sovereignty over human affairs. This aligns with Job 12:10, Proverbs 21:1, Daniel 4:35, Isaiah 41:10, and Romans 8:28, all affirming God's control over human life and destiny.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 9:2 say about the fate of the righteous and the wicked?
options: They share the same event or fate
questions.correctAnswer: They share the same event or fate
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:2 explains that both the righteous and the wicked encounter the same event, referring to death or fate under the sun. This is consistent with Hebrews 9:27, Ecclesiastes 3:19, Psalm 49:10, Job 21:23-26, and Romans 3:23, emphasizing human mortality and the universality of death.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 9:4 compares the living to the dead by saying, 'a living dog is better than a dead ______.' What word completes this comparison?
questions.explanation: Verse 9:4 says that a living dog is better than a dead lion, illustrating the value of life despite status. This theme resonates with John 11:25, Psalm 146:3-4, Ecclesiastes 3:4, Isaiah 38:1, and Philippians 1:21, which emphasize life, hope, and God's sovereignty over death.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 9:5 say about the knowledge of the dead?
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 9:5 declares that the dead know nothing and have no reward, highlighting the cessation of earthly knowledge and activity after death. This accords with Psalm 146:4, Ecclesiastes 3:19, Isaiah 38:18, Ecclesiastes 12:7, and Luke 16:26, underscoring the finality of death in earthly terms.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 9:7, what attitude should one have when eating bread and drinking wine?
questions.explanation: Verse 9:7 encourages eating and drinking with joy because God accepts one's works. This reflects a biblical call to rejoice in God's provision as seen in Psalm 104:14-15, 1 Timothy 6:17, Ecclesiastes 8:15, John 15:11, and Philippians 4:4.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 9:10 instructs to do whatever your hand finds to do with what characteristic?
questions.explanation: The verse calls for wholehearted effort ('with thy might') because there is no work or wisdom in the grave. This is consistent with Colossians 3:23, Proverbs 22:29, Ecclesiastes 11:6, 2 Timothy 2:15, and Romans 12:11, encouraging diligence in earthly duties.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 9:11 teaches that success is not guaranteed to the swift, strong, or wise because what happens to all?
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes that time and chance affect everyone regardless of ability, underscoring life's unpredictability. This aligns with Proverbs 16:33, Job 1:21, Matthew 10:29, James 4:13-15, and Ecclesiastes 3:1, teaching humility and trust in God's sovereign timing.

questions.question: What analogy does Ecclesiastes 9:12 use to describe how humans are caught unexpectedly in evil times?
options: Fish in a net and birds in a snare
Lions in a trap and wolves in a den
Sheep in a fold and goats in a pen
Eagles in a storm and doves in a cage
questions.correctAnswer: Fish in a net and birds in a snare
questions.explanation: Verse 9:12 compares humans caught in evil times to fish taken in a net and birds in a snare, illustrating sudden calamity. This imagery is echoed in Job 12:14, Psalm 124:7, Proverbs 1:17, Luke 21:34-35, and Matthew 24:43-44, warning of unexpected judgment.

questions.question: In Ecclesiastes 9:15, what saved the city besieged by a great king?
options: The wisdom of a poor man
questions.correctAnswer: The wisdom of a poor man
questions.explanation: The verse highlights that a poor wise man delivered the city by his wisdom, though he was forgotten. This stresses the value of wisdom over strength, consistent with Proverbs 3:13-18, James 1:5, 1 Corinthians 1:27, Daniel 2:21, and Matthew 11:19.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 9:16, how is the poor man's wisdom regarded by others?
questions.explanation: The verse states the poor man's wisdom is despised and his words are not heard, illustrating human rejection of true wisdom. This parallels 1 Corinthians 1:26-29, Matthew 23:34, Proverbs 1:7, Isaiah 29:14, and Jeremiah 5:21 about the rejection of God's wisdom.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 9:17 say about the words of wise men compared to the cry of rulers among fools?
options: Wise words are heard in quiet more than loud cries
questions.correctAnswer: Wise words are heard in quiet more than loud cries
questions.explanation: This verse teaches that wise counsel is more effective in calm than the noisy shouting of fools, affirming Proverbs 17:28, James 1:19, Ecclesiastes 7:5, Proverbs 15:1, and Isaiah 32:2 about the power of wisdom and gentle speech.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 9:18 states that wisdom is better than what?
questions.explanation: The verse affirms that wisdom surpasses weapons of war in value, though one sinner can destroy much good. This is compatible with Proverbs 24:6, James 3:17, Ecclesiastes 7:12, Psalm 144:1, and Romans 16:19, emphasizing the superiority of wisdom over violence.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 9:6 mentions certain emotions that perish with death. Which of these is NOT listed?
questions.explanation: Verse 9:6 lists love, hatred, and envy as perishing with death, but faith is not mentioned and is biblically considered eternal (Hebrews 11:1; 1 Corinthians 13:13; 2 Timothy 4:7-8; John 20:31; Romans 10:17).

questions.question: What instruction does Ecclesiastes 9:8 give regarding personal appearance?
options: Keep garments white and head anointed
Wear humble clothes and avoid ointment
Dress plainly and do not adorn yourself
Change garments frequently and avoid pride
questions.correctAnswer: Keep garments white and head anointed
questions.explanation: The verse advises maintaining white garments and anointed head, symbolizing purity and joy, which relates to Isaiah 61:3, Revelation 7:9, Psalm 23:5, Luke 7:38, and 1 Samuel 16:13 on being set apart and blessed.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 9:9, with whom should one live joyfully all the days of life?
questions.explanation: Verse 9:9 calls for joyful life with one's beloved wife, underscoring the gift and portion of life under the sun. This echoes Genesis 2:24, Proverbs 18:22, Ephesians 5:25-33, Song of Solomon 8:6-7, and 1 Corinthians 7:3-4 on the sanctity of marital love.
